headline: Berkshire Hathaway Bets on the New York Times. Buffett Wins Again.
summary: Warren Buffett has long been a fan of newspapers, so much so that  Apple  even developed a paper-tossing game as an app for the iPhone for a  Berkshire Hathaway  shareholder meeting a few years ago.  Berkshire recently disclosed a new stake in  New York Times  , the publishing company that is thriving in the midst of the traditional-media downturn.  The Oracle of Omaha’s conglomerate said that it had acquired a little more than five million shares of New York Times stock in the fourth quarter.

The Oracle of Omaha’s conglomerate said that it had acquired a little more than five million shares of New York Times stock in the fourth quarter.

headline: BlackRock Announces Completion of Certain Municipal CEF Reorganizations and Adoption of Discount Management Programs
summary: NEW YORK, February 23, 2026--BlackRock Advisors, LLC announced today each of the closed-end funds named below (each, a "Fund" and collectively, the "Funds") have completed their reorganizations (each, a "Reorganization" and collectively, the "Reorganizations"). Additionally, each of the Survivor Funds, as identified below, adopted a Discount Management Program that seeks to enhance long-term shareholder value via periodic liquidity events if certain conditions are met (see below for details).

headline: Hedge Funds That Piled Into US Bitcoin Funds Are First to Exit
summary: Aggregate Bitcoin ETF allocations among the largest hedge fund holders fell 28% from the third to the fourth quarter of 2025, according to data compiled by CF Benchmarks, a wholly-owned subsidiary of crypto exchange Kraken.  Bitcoin is down almost 50% from its October peak of over $126,000.  “The dominant theme over the last two quarters was hedge fund de-risking,” Gabe Selby, head of research at CF Benchmarks, wrote in a Feb. 19 research note.
